meanings.definition: Not worth remembering or easily forgotten.
meanings.sent1: The movie was unmemorable, I forgot about it the next day.
meanings.sent2: The unmemorable party had no exciting moments to recall.
meanings.sent3: The unmemorable sandwich tasted like cardboard, I won't be ordering that again!
meanings.sent4: Her unmemorable performance in the play left the audience yawning.
meanings.sent5: The unmemorable lecture put everyone to sleep within minutes.

meanings.sent1: The painting was unmemorable, blending in with the rest of the art in the gallery.
meanings.sent2: His unmemorable speech failed to capture the attention of the audience.
meanings.sent3: The unmemorable outfit she wore made her look like just another person in the crowd.
meanings.sent4: The unmemorable sunset faded quickly from memory, overshadowed by more vibrant ones.
meanings.sent5: The unmemorable book lacked any unique characters or plot twists.
